topic.title: Deploying ESX with NoOp Driver in EON
topic.shortdesc: To deploy ESX with NoOp driver in EON, the input model should be modified.

section.title: NoOp Driver
section.p:
You must delete the parameters from the following files of the input model to deploy ESX with NoOp driver in EON.
Delete the following parameters from ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml file.- name: esx-ovsvapp resource-prefix: esx-ovsvapp server-role: OVSVAPP-ROLE allocation-policy: any service-components: - neutron-ovsvapp-agent - ntp-client - eon-client
Delete the following parameters from ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/net_interfaces.yml file. # The interface required for the OVSvApp service VM - name: OVSVAPP-INTERFACES network-interfaces: - name: eth0 device: name: eth0 network-groups: - CONF - name: eth1 device: name: eth1 network-groups: - MANAGEMENT - name: eth2 device: name: eth2 network-groups: - GUEST - name: eth3 device: name: eth3 network-groups: - TRUNK
Delete the following parameters from ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/network_groups.yml file. tags: - neutron.ovsvapp.management_if
# # TRUNK # # This is the network group that will be used for # trunk network on the OVSvApp service VM. # The trunk network is used to apply security # group rules on tenant traffic. - name: TRUNK hostname-suffix: trunk tags: - neutron.ovsvapp.sec_bridge_if
Delete the following parameters from ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/networks.yml file. - name: TRUNK-NET tagged-vlan: false network-group: TRUNK
Delete the following parameters under networks from ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/server_groups.yml file.- TRUNK-NET
Delete the following parameters from ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/server_roles.yml file.- name: OVSVAPP-ROLE interface-model: OVSVAPP-INTERFACES disk-model: HLINUX-VM-DISKS
After modifying the input model you can commit you cloud configuration as mentioned in and proceed further.
